cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 35 mi NNE of Tiburon, Haiti and about 90 mi S of the eastern tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, expected to turn north-northwest Wednesday and then northwest toward the northwestern Bahamas and the Florida east coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along Florida east coast (likely between Cape Canaveral and Jacksonville)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Deerfield Beach FL to the Volusia/Brevard county line under Hurricane Watch; Seven Mile Bridge to south of Deerfield Beach under Tropical Storm Watch
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warnings in effect for Haiti, portions of Cuba, and the Bahamas (no U.S. warnings yet)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. Atlantic coast from Florida through the Carolinas likely to feel impacts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are probable (34–52% chance); 50-kt winds have a 17% chance, hurricane-force winds cannot be ruled out if the core moves closer.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potentially life-threatening surge of 3–5+ ft along the northeast Florida coast including the St. Johns River mouth.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could bring 4–7 inches with isolated higher totals, producing flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and coastal erosion will hamper port operations and vessel movements.
